feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: 4AN combined with intercompany allocation
entry.content:
Hello, 

we try to use the 4AN new ressource related intercompany billing in combination with an intercompany allocation (Manage Allocations F3338A). The allocation account we use is the standard YCOA account 94201000 (Buildings & PerSer). In general we use 4AN already for IC billing with activity type and primary GL account - it works fine. But with YCOA account 94201000 (Buildings & PerSer) the system does not find any posting to create the intercompany billing request. Is there a different setting we have to take that results of an allocation are considered for the IC billing? 

Best regards
Anja

entry.title: Tax statement item missing for tax code V0 in intercompany billing VF02
entry.content:
Dear SAP members,

I'm trying to test Intercompany STO process in our system.
I'm able to create PO#, OutboundDelivery# and successfully finished Post GI.
But after that when I'm trying to create Billing document.

I'm facing "Tax statement item missing for tax code V0" this error in our system.

Can you explain why this happens in our system?

Best Regards,

entry.title: OAuth2.0 Authentication Error When Setting Up Comm. Arrangement for an External API in Public Cloud
entry.content:
The objective is to consume the IRBM API (used for Malaysian e-invoicing) directly from S/4 Public Cloud.
And for that, we created a Communication Arrangement to establish the connection but we’re getting an authentication error when checking the connection:

Below are the setups for Communication Arrangement & System. For the Communication System, we specified the URL under Hostname and set Port as “443” for HTTPS call.

Under the OAuth 2.0 Settings, the base url with “/connect/token” are specified in order to get the token. 

NOTE: I have tried to remove the Authorization Endpoint and make it empty but it’s still throwing the same issue:

Also, an outbound user with OAuth2.0 authentication is set up to call the IRBM API from S/4 Public Cloud:

Here’s the setup for the Communication Arrangement where we specified an additional scope “Invoicing API”.

We’ve tested this API in Postman, and it works fine as token can be retrieved successfully.

1 point to note, we also included the parameter grant_type during Postman testing but from my understanding this will be automatically handled by standard. But please let me know if this not the case or there’s a missing setup in the Communication System or Arrangement.

entry.title: Error in creating billing document in intercompany STO
entry.content:
Dear SAP community

I'm testing the intercompany STO in our system.
I finished BP and Material and other configsetting, creating PO# and Delivery# and POST GI, also Supplier Invoice.

But when I'm trying to create Billing document, there is no journal account is generated with this error.
"Tax statement item missing for tax code V0"

Can you give any advice why this error happens and why tax code for purchasing V0 affects the Billing document?

Kindly give any solution to solve this issue.

Best Regards,

entry.title: Value Help in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition always resets and shows all entries
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are using S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

As shown in the attached screenshot, whenever I open a value help (for example, on customer or vendor fields), the dialog always resets and displays the full list of entries.

This is problematic in customer demos because we do not want to expose test or irrelevant master data.
Ideally, I would like to:
- Keep the last-used filter criteria when reopening the value help, or
- Apply a predefined default filter (e.g., Country = JP) automatically when opening the dialog.

So far I have tried:
- Personal Value List → lets me mark favorite values, but does not preserve filter conditions
- “Default Values” in Fiori Settings → works for global fields like company code, but not inside value help filters
- Variants → not available in certain apps (e.g., Invoice Summarization / Periodic Billing)

**My questions:**
1. Is there any standard way in Public Cloud to persist or predefine filter criteria in the value help dialog?
2. If not, should I understand this behavior as a system limitation by design?
3. How do other companies typically handle this in demos or daily operations when the value help contains many entries?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: What Does Each Block Item Control in 'Define Reasons for Blocking in Shipping'?
entry.content:
Hello. I am currently investigating the specifications of shipping blocks. In the "Define Reasons for Blocking in Shipping" app, in the CBC, multiple block reasons are assumed, as shown in the image below. This time, I entered the block reasons defined in this app into the "Central Delivery Block" field in the "Manage Customer Master" app, and I am checking the behavior of each block item.

The "Order Block" actually blocked the creation of sales orders, but for the other block items, although the creation of delivery documents was blocked, I could not understand the differences in their behavior. Furthermore, even when using a block reason with all block item checkboxes unchecked, the creation of delivery documents was still blocked. Therefore, I am unsure what each block item checkbox actually controls.

Could you please explain what each block item in the "Define Reasons for Blocking in Shipping" app is intended to block? Also, which application should I use to verify the behavior when a block is applied?

I would appreciate your advice. Thank you in advance for your response.

entry.title: Enabling 'Compliance' tab in Purchase order header & Line item in SAP Public cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

We are using SAP Public Cloud integrated with SAP GTS. As per upgrade 2508, the fields Total Embargo Status, Total Screening Status, and Total Legal Control Status should appear under the Compliance tab in the purchase order header and line items.

We have already activated the check in Activate Checks for Purchasing Documents under General Settings for Trade Compliance. The fields are now visible; however, they are not capturing the block status. For example, we have a PO blocked in GTS due to an embargo, but the status still shows as “Not relevant, no check.”

Could you please advise what additional configuration or background jobs need to be set up for POs so that this works correctly.

Thanks in advance! 

Adyasha

entry.title: Version management in PO
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I read that version management can be activated only for the purchase contract as of now in SAP public cloud. My client wants to send latest version of PO form to supplier. How to achieve this. which field can be considered in PO so that it can be printed on PO forms.

Thanks

Pavan Kumar

entry.title: Incorrect Creation Time Displayed in Billing Document (VF01), Sales Document(VA01) Etc.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are facing an issue related to document creation time in our SAP system.

For example:

  • Today (03/10/2025) at 05:51 PM (local system time), I created a billing document.

  • After creation, when I display the billing document in VF03, the creation time shown is 12:28 PM instead of the actual time when the billing was created.

This issue is not limited to one user – it is happening for all clients in our system during sales order creation, delivery, and billing document creation.

Our business requirement is to capture and display the exact creation time of the document. Could you please advise:

  1. Why is there a mismatch between the actual creation time and the time displayed in VF03?

  2. Is this related to time zone settings (user profile/system/application server)?

  3. What is the recommended way to rectify this issue so that the correct creation time is displayed?

Any guidance or best practices to resolve this will be highly appreciated.

Thank you,
Tharmaraj S

Thanks,

entry.title: S/4HANA API for A_JournalEntryItemBasic changes order of results if $select fields
entry.content:
When I query using the REST API the A_JournalEntryItemBasic resource of the API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV service, if I change the list of fields to retrieve, using the $select parameter, then the order of the results change. Even if I add an $orderby !

For example, I expect that a GET request to this two URLs return the same record (same ID, same URI) but represented with a different set of fields. Because I'm passing `$top=1` so only the first result should be returned:

  1. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=ID%2CLedger%2CLedgerName%2CSourceLedger%2CLedg
    erFiscalYear%2CControllingArea%2CControllingAreaName%2CCompanyCode%2CCompanyCodeName%2CGLAccount%2CGLAccountName&%24orderby=Ledger
  2. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=WBSElement%2CWBSElementDescription%2CPartnerCo
    mpanyCode%2CPartnerCompanyCodeName%2CCostCtrActivityType%2CCostCtrActivityTypeName%2COrderID%2CLedger&%24orderby=Ledger

But two different URIs are returned. First:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'ID': '.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001',
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'LedgerName': 'Management Accounting',
 'SourceLedger': '0L',
 'LedgerFiscalYear': '2018',
 'ControllingArea': 'A000',
 'ControllingAreaName': 'Controlling Area A000',
 'CompanyCode': '1010',
 'CompanyCodeName': 'BestRun DE',
 'GLAccount': '1',
 'GLAccountName': 'Paybls Domestic'}

And second:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'WBSElement': '',
 'WBSElementDescription': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCode': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCodeName': '',
 'CostCtrActivityType': '',
 'CostCtrActivityTypeName': '',
 'OrderID': ''}

The OData specification says:

Select System Query Option ($select): A data service URI with a $select System Query Option identifies the same set of entities as a URI without a $select query option; however, the presence of a $select query option specifies that a response from the data service SHOULD return a subset, as identified by the value of the $select query option, of the properties that would have been returned had the URI not included a $select query option.

What am I missing?

 

UPDATE:
Apparently what I take as a row ID is actually a GENERATED_ID : a special property name used in OData services to uniquely identify aggregated or grouped data records. When you request aggregated data in an OData service, a GENERATED_ID property is automatically created for each resulting group. This ID serves as a unique key for that aggregated record, allowing you to request the same aggregated data again by referencing this ID.

So now, I don't know how to identify rows and thus how to match two rows from different queries. Can I rely on the order of the results?

entry.title: How to grey out the Delete button in VA02？
entry.content:
I’m trying to grey out the Delete button in VA02on S/4HANA Public Cloud, but I’m not sure how to achieve this.

Could anyone advise:

  • Which app or configuration should be used to control this behavior?
  • What kind of ABAP logic or extension might be needed to disable or hide the button?

Any insights or examples would be really appreciated. Thanks!

entry.title: Revenue recognition key EPMFC EPPM (Project Management) module in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition.
entry.content:
I have a question about the EPPM (Project Management) module in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition. With the revenue recognition key EPMFC, revenue is recognized based on the cost-based percentage-of-completion method. When actual costs exceed planned costs, can the progress rate exceed 100% and be recognized accordingly? Or does the progress rate cap at 100% even if actual costs surpass planned costs?

Examples:
- When planned cost = actual cost:
Planned cost 500, actual cost 500, revenue 1,000 (100%)
- When planned cost > actual cost:
Planned cost 500, actual cost 250, revenue 500 (50%)
- Questioned case: when planned cost < actual cost:
Is it planned cost 500, actual cost 1,000, revenue 1,000 (100%), or
planned cost 500, actual cost 1,000, revenue 2,000 (200%)?

entry.title: Posting of Recognized Revenue for Cost‑Based Percentage‑of‑Completion Revenue Projects
entry.content:
Regarding Project Sales (4I9) and Event-Based Revenue Recognition (4GQ) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition, we have configured a revenue-bearing project and set the revenue recognition key to EPMFC (cost-based percentage of completion). Recognized Cost of Sales (Recognized COS) has been posted without issues, but Recognized Revenue is still not being posted. Could you help us identify the cause?

With Planned COS of 10,000,000 JPY and Recognized COS of 5,000,000 JPY, the percentage of completion should be 50%, and Recognized Revenue should be 10,000,000 JPY.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud Report Formatting (Financial Statements / Dynamic Reporting)
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could you please confirm how we can develop custom forms in the Public Cloud environment similar to what we are used to in RISE or On-Prem solutions — where we typically utilize a custom driver program to call custom Adobe Forms?

From what I understand, the functionality in Public Cloud seems to be limited to formatting existing forms by copying them or adding a few additional fields. However, I have the following specific requirements which involve more advanced formatting and development capabilities:

  1. Development of a New Custom Program:
    Ability to create and execute a completely new program that displays a custom Adobe Form, without attaching it to or replacing with any standard form.

  2. Formatting Financial Statements:
    The current formats for Balance Sheet and Cash Flow statements are missing key formatting elements (e.g., bold or italic headings). We need to apply advanced formatting to improve readability and presentation.

  3. Displaying Dynamic Images in Forms:
    Requirement to dynamically display images (e.g., product return images, reflecting damages) within delivery or return sales order forms, after uploading them to a repository or storage area in Public Cloud.

entry.title: BAPI for updating Payment Reference number
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are currently working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – Grow Edition and have encountered a scenario where we need to update the Payment Reference Number in an accounting entry via automation. However, we have been unable to identify a suitable BAPI or Behavior Definition that allows us to perform this update.

We are aware of the I_JOURNALENTRYTP interface, which is typically used for updating accounting entries. However, we have not been able to locate a relevant field within this API that supports updating the payment reference.

 

We would appreciate your assistance in identifying:

Any available standard APIs or extensibility options to achieve this.

Relevant documentation or alternative approaches to update the Payment Reference Number in accounting entries.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Unable to Execute “Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Purchases” in Background
entry.content:
While executing the GST report using the Fiori app “Create Advance Return for Tax on Sales/Purchases”, we noticed that the option “Execute in Background” is greyed out and cannot be selected.

In the ECC system, there was an option to process the batch input session immediately or execute the report directly in background.

However, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, we can only execute the report interactively. When the batch input session is created, it can be viewed under the app “Batch Input Sessions in My Area”, but there is no option to process these sessions in background - only foreground execution is possible.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: G/L Account master data not updated in Quality environment
entry.content:
During the deployment project, we are facing an issue updating the Chart of account and the related settings per company code.

indeed, in quality an account doesn't exist and we don't have any dependencies defined while releasing the order or that given account. only ones are out own transport request which are already imported in Quality environment.

Steps to reproduce 

Go in tile Manage G/L account Master Data

Select account 

make a change in the account (untick blocked for planning as an example)

save your change

Release the order

Import order in quality

result : Account doesn't exist in YCOA

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Unavailability of Released CDS view for Warehouse task - Internal moment
entry.content:
Requirement - Pack outbound delivery - HU Based - GI Label trigger with left over stock

We are printing the GI label with reference to the Outbound delivery number from SAP to 3rd Party system while using the App Pack outbound deliveries with reference to the Outbound delivery number. It is a Warehouse task and getting confirmed, but the warehouse task details do not contain the reference document of the Outbound delivery number in any CDS Views or SAP standard tables.

However, we found the SAP standard CDS view "I_EWM_handlingunititem", which contains the Outbound Delivery details. But this is not yet released in the 2508 version.  

Technical Design: We are using an event-based triggering process for the above requirement. Below is the Event used for Warehouse Internal moment(Leftover Stock) Labels.

Event - sap/s4/beh/WarehouseOrder/TaskConfirmed/v1

Once the packing is done in the app "Pack Outbound Delivery", the Warehouse Task event gets triggered. Based on the Warehouse task, we need to obtain all the required details from the Outbound Delivery. So the challenge is that we don"t have a released CDS View(I_EWM_handlingunititem) to find the Outbound delivery number linkage from packed outbound delivery warehouse task details. We need a workaround solution as this requirement is crucial for the Business to operate and print the labels in the warehouse. 

Test case in dev tenant.

Sales order: 3344

Outbound delivery:80001610

HU: 300010677 of Warehouse task 1000007840

HU 300010678 of Warehouse task 1000007841
